{"step_by_step_thinking": "The lateral lingual swellings and tuberculum impar are embryonic structures that contribute to the development of the tongue. The anterior 2/3 of the tongue is derived from the first pharyngeal arch, while the posterior 1/3 of the tongue is derived from the third and fourth pharyngeal arches. Therefore, the lateral lingual swellings and tuberculum impar give rise to the anterior 2/3 of the tongue.", "answer_choice": "B. Anterior 2/3 of tongue"}
